com.mostc.host
Class LocalHost

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.host.Host
      com.mostc.host.LocalHost

public class LocalHost
extends Host

Represents the local Host that the program is currently running on.

exec

public ExecOutput exec(java.lang.String commandline,
                       int timeout,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                       byte[] stdin,
                       java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                       java.lang.String chdir)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: Host
executes the given program

Specified by:
exec in class Host
Parameters:
commandline - - program to run
timeout - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
stdin - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
chdir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
Host.NO_TIMEOUT

getContentsDetectCharset

public java.lang.String getContentsDetectCharset(java.lang.String file,
                                                 CharsetDeciderDecoder cdd)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: Host
gets the contents of the file as single unicode string, automatically detecting the character set and converting the bytes to a string (supports exotic charsets like EUC-CN or SHIFT_JS). Note: this takes extra time, often most files can be read with just #getContents because they don't use exotic charsets

Specified by:
getContentsDetectCharset in class Host
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException
